result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Batchelor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Maurice Batchelor is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Maurice Batchelor was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Maurice Batchelor was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.  DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during Extended Supervision.  Unpaid portion to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.  Credit for 433 days.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. mag
Defendant's motion to vacate DNA surcharge.
Original Transcript (44 pages)SENTENCING HEARING commencing 05-17-2016 received and filed.

BRANCH 26 FOR BRANCH 35.  Petitioner Arthur Strong appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Zach Wittchow.
Deputy Court Clerk:  aa
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by  counsel.  Court grants petition.  Filed, signed Order.  Smith and Wesson pistol, magazines and cartridges returned.
Return of property hearing on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
MPD Inventory #15007863(ARTHUR STRONG).

Defendant Maurice Batchelor in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Maurice Batchelor in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeds.  Statements made as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS (CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2), with credit for 433 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS (CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program" AFTER SERVING TWO YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT SENTENCE. 

Court orders restitution set at $0. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs and surcharges, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid portion to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Letter from Nissen Staffing;
Certificate of Baptism.

Defendant Maurice Batchelor in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered count 3 dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2: Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms OR BODY ARMOUR. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
COURT LIFTS NO CONTACT ORDER AS TO L.W.T.

Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Matter is scheduled for jury trial.  State is ready to proceed.  Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct trial today.  Matter is spun to Judge Thomas McAdams forthwith.

Defendant Maurice Batchelor in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Maurice Batchelor in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds final pretrial conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter continues on the record.  Discovery issue placed on the record.  Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for SPEEDY jury trial on 4/25/16 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Defendant Maurice Batchelor in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Maurice Batchelor in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds final pretrial conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter continues on the record.  Defense requests adjournment of 4/11/16 trial date to allow time for to prepare for trial.  Defense speedy trial demand expires 5/9/16.  Court orders 4/11/16 jury trial date converted to final pretrial conference.  New trial date selected within speedy trial timeframe.  Any pending motions to be heard on the day of trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Maurice Batchelor in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Maurice Batchelor in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Matter continues on the record.  Counsel was recently appointed, new trial date is selected.  Court places status on the record.  Defendant's SPEEDY trial demand expires today.  Defense motion to reduce bail argued and DENIED by the Court.  For reasons as stated on the record, Court finds there is good cause to adjourn trial, Court orders speedy trial demand withdrawn.  Defendant reinvokes speedy trial demand (EXPIRES: 5/9/16).  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Maurice Batchelor in court with attorney Vladimir M. Gorokhovsky.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Court places status on the record.  State was unable to have witness interviewed, Court makes record.  Court hears argument.  Matter will not proceed to trial today.  Defense renews motion to dismiss case and motion to withdraw as counsel.  Court denies motion to dismiss and grants motion to withdraw.  Court orders counsel withdrawn as counsel of record forthwith.  Counsel to notify OPD immediately and advise that an expedited appointment is needed.  Court DOES NOT withdraw speedy trial at this time (expires: 2/8/16).  Court orders matter adjourned for status conference, defendant to be produced on next date.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice Batchelor in court with attorney Vladimir M. Gorokhovsky.  Defendant Maurice Batchelor in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for SPEEDY jury trial today.  Defense counsel advises the Court that there may be an additional witness needed for trial.  Court hears argument.  State to contact potential witness and report back to the Court.  Court orders jury trial continued to tomorrow, 2/2/16 at 8:30am in br. 35.  Court takes defense motion to dismiss and motion to withdraw under advisement.

Defendant Maurice Batchelor not in court, defendant in custody.  Defense counsel does not appear.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk:  vk  Deputy court clerk spoke with Attorney Gorokhovsky on the telephone.  He states he is ill and can not appear for today's scheduled motion hearing.  Court adjourns the motion hearing to the date of the jury trial in Branch 35.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Court denies request at this time, counsel to remain as counsel of record.  Matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 2/1/16 at 9:30am in Room 632 of the Courthouse.  Counsel requests motion date.
